page.title: 13FARMING, RAGDALE AREA _ 1
page.content:
This part of North_East Leicestershire is mainly an arable farming area.
Crops grown include wheat, barley, oats, and some oil seed rape. These are grown on the south_eastern slope from the main plateau above Ragdale Village.
Mixed with the crops on the south_ eastern slopes there is intensively managed grassland. Such grassland is also to be found in the valley through which the Ox Brook runs.
Enclosed rough grazing is to be found in the quite deep valley to the north_ east and also on the slopes as the valley rises to the north_east end of the plateau.
